summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from July 23, 2019, showing a Washington Post reporter reaching out for comment on Jeffrey Epstein being found unconscious in his jail cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The internal response instructs recipients to decline comment.

persons.name: Devlin Barrett
persons.context: Reporter who emailed inquiring about Jeffrey Epstein being found unconscious in his jail cell at MCC, requesting a call for comment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: MCC inmate who was found unconscious and unresponsive in his jail cell, prompting an internal inquiry.

events.title: Epstein found unconscious in jail cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unconscious and unresponsive in his jail cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), prompting an internal inquiry to determine if it was self-harm, a medical problem, or an attack by someone else.

keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found unconscious and unresponsive in his jail cell at MCC.
An internal inquiry was launched to determine if the incident was due to self-harm, a medical problem, or an attack by someone else.
A Washington Post reporter, Devlin Barrett, reached out for comment, but the internal response was to decline to comment.
